cs.GT, cs.EC, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the allocation of resources to agents, which is a classic problem in game theory (cs.GT) and economics (cs.EC). The focus on fairness and efficiency measures suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of algorithmic game theory (cs.ALGAM), which studies the design and analysis of algorithms for strategic agents. The use of truthful mechanisms is a key aspect of the paper, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of mechanism design (cs.DS). The paper also mentions a motivating example from the privatization auction in the Czech Republic, which suggests that it may be relevant to the subfield of applied game theory (cs.AI) or empirical game theory (cs.LG).
